arch:property.oc:show_val: North end W CP East, area of robbed pavers (Tr. 97, 2004, Locus 23).
1.60 m north south-by-2.0 m east west.

Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The full Lower Temenos is constructed, complete with additional subterranean channels and drains, the Hexagonal Pavement, the East and West Triple Colonnades and Cryptoportici, the East and West Exedrae and the Lower Temenos Retaining Wall. East west crosswall is built in the West Cryptoporticus ca. 20 m north of the West Exedra.

This is a fill locus containing both rubble and soil. The soil is a combination of silt and sand with a Munsell Color 7.5 YR 5/4 (Brown). The soil was compacted around a jumble of medium boulders, wadi/field stones, cobbles, and pebbles. The fill contained pottery, bone, and a piece of stone which might be a marble fragment. This stratum is the second thickest deposit in the sounding (cf. Locus 3).
Fill locus of mixed soil, boulders, and wadi/field stones.
